thread.title: Watch A 7-Months-Pregnant Sharon Van Etten Play New Songs At ACLU And Planned Parenthood Benefit In Brooklyn
thread.title_full: Watch A 7-Months-Pregnant Sharon Van Etten Play New Songs At ACLU And Planned Parenthood Benefit In Brooklyn

author: Gabriela Tully Claymore
title: Watch A 7-Months-Pregnant Sharon Van Etten Play New Songs At ACLU And Planned Parenthood Benefit In Brooklyn
text:
Gabriela Tully Claymore @gabrielajunetc | January 19, 2017 - 2:21 pm Share < br />this article: 
Sharon Van Etten played new songs at an anti-Trump benefit for Planned Parenthood and the ACLU that took place at Music Hall Of Williamsburg last night. The musician is seven months pregnant, and she played a few older songs for the audience — like “Serpent,”“Lucky Stars,” and “Don’t Do It”— on top of two fresh ones. Beirut, Kevin Morby, Hand Habits, and Daniel Rossen also performed, and the second night of the benefit series goes down tonight at Rough Trade . On top of writing new music, Van Etten recently appeared in the Netflix series The OA , and she has been cast in Twin Peaks as well. Check out fan-shot footage from her performance below. A video posted by Miss Lord (@therarehold) on Jan 18, 2017 at 11:28pm PST 
UPDATE: Sharon Van Etten also sang backup vocals on Kevin Morby’s cover of Leonard Cohen’s “Passing Through,” with Meg Duffy of Hand Habits on guitar. Watch that below.
